author: Olivia Taylor
title: Paycom Earns Praise for Exceptional Employee Experience and Culture - Investors Hangout
text: Paycom Earns Praise for Exceptional Employee Experience and Culture [Olivia Taylor](https://investorshangout.com/profile/view?id=79141)Updated: 09-19-2024 04:13 PM Paycom's Recognition in Workplace Culture Paycom Software, Inc. (NYSE: PAYC), a leader in cloud-based human capital management solutions, has recently been acknowledged for fostering a positive workplace culture as highlighted by Comparably, an employee review and salary platform. This recognition underscores Paycom's commitment to not only delivering exceptional software solutions but also nurturing an environment where employees feel valued and engaged. Commitment to Employee Satisfaction In a recent survey, Paycom secured impressive rankings, placing No. 5 among large companies in the U.S. and Canada with the happiest employees. Furthermore, they ranked No. 5 for offering the Best Company Perks & Benefits, demonstrating their commitment to providing employees with a robust range of benefits that support their personal and professional lives. Key Benefits Offered Paycom’s emphasis on employee well-being is evident in their comprehensive benefits package, which includes remarkably low-cost individual health insurance at $1 per pay period, a generous 401(k) plan with matching contributions, paid family leave, and even pet insurance. One employee expressed their appreciation by stating, “The benefits and pay are the best I’ve experienced in my career so far.” This feedback is a true testament to Paycom's dedication to their workforce. Valuable Employee Insights The Comparably Awards are uniquely based on honest feedback from current employees who rate their workplace anonymously over a 12-month period. This year, Paycom’s recognition was rooted in the following criteria: satisfaction with workplace happiness, the value of benefits offered, and perceptions of work-life balance. Positive Work Environment One employee from Paycom's finance department remarked on the positive culture prevalent in the company, indicating how fulfilling it is to know their work contributes to the company’s growth. They highlighted that the friendships formed in the workplace significantly enhance their job satisfaction, showcasing the interpersonal connections that are nurtured within the organization. Additional Awards Highlighting Paycom's Excellence Paycom's achievements don’t stop at employee happiness alone. Earlier accolades awarded to the company by Comparably include distinctions such as Best Company for Career Growth and Best Company Leadership. These awards reflect a broader scope of recognition that emphasizes Paycom’s comprehensive approach to nurturing talent and leadership capabilities. Outlook and Future Growth In the competitive landscape of human resources, Paycom remains focused on innovation and improvement. Their culture encourages continuous growth and development, providing employees with opportunities to advance their careers. Paycom is paving the way for businesses of all sizes, leveraging their technology to improve both operational efficiency and employee satisfaction. Joining the Paycom Team For those interested in becoming part of an organization that prioritizes workplace culture and employee welfare, Paycom offers a variety of career opportunities. The commitment to nurturing employee experiences is matched by a dedication to meaningful work, making Paycom a desirable place to build a career. About Paycom With 25 years in the industry, Paycom Software, Inc. (NYSE: PAYC) has revolutionized how businesses manage their human capital through intuitive HR and payroll technology. Their innovative solutions empower employees by providing direct access to their HR data, fostering a culture of transparency. Their groundbreaking product, Beti, allows employees to take charge of their own payroll, identifying and rectifying any errors before submission, which significantly enhances accuracy and trust in the payroll process. Frequently Asked Questions What is Paycom recognized for? Paycom has received national recognition for its exceptional workplace culture, focusing on employee satisfaction and benefits. What benefits does Paycom offer its employees? Paycom offers numerous benefits, including low-cost health insurance, a 401(k) plan with matching contributions, paid family leave, and pet insurance. How did Comparably determine the awarded rankings? Comparably's awards are based on anonymous feedback from employees regarding their workplace satisfaction over a year's period. What other accolades has Paycom received? In addition to employee happiness, Paycom has received awards for Best Company for Career Growth and Best Company Leadership. How can one apply for a position at Paycom? Interested individuals can explore career opportunities at Paycom by visiting their official careers webpage, where numerous job openings are listed. author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: The personal life of Íñigo Errejón: his controversies, his relationship with Rita Maestre and his political divorce from Pablo Iglesias
text:
Íñigo Errejón has resigned this Thursday, October 24, through a statement on X, formerly Twitter, after two thirty in the afternoon. Sumar’s until then spokesperson in Congress thus leaves his seat in the Congress of Deputies and retires from politics.
In the statement, the politician indicates having reached “the limit of the contradiction between the character and the person. Between a neoliberal way of life and being a spokesperson for a formation that defends a new world. Furthermore, he has alluded to “patriarchy” and «psychological support process» in which he has been immersed for “some time”.
At the moment Sumar has communicated that a information gathering process about some rumors that had emerged about Errejón’s sexist behavior with some girls, most of them spread through social networks.
«I announce thus, as I have already communicated to my colleagues in charge, my resignation as spokesperson for the Plurinational Parliamentary Group of Sumar, I leave the seat in Congress and all my political responsibilities,” explained the former deputy on his Twitter account.
After his resignation, it remains to be seen what the suspicions about the former deputy take shape, of whom we review his personal and private career since he entered the political arena.
Íñigo Errejón and some controversial beginnings in politics
Born in Madrid on December 14, 40 years ago, Errejón has a doctorate in Political Sciences from the Complutense University of Madrid. Errejón was one of the best-known faces of the 15M movement and one of the few who had resisted until now in politics.
He was one of the founders of Podemos and managed to become a deputy in Congress and later move away from the purple formation. He moved to Manuela Carmen’s Más Madrid, which later became Más País, a party with which he was also a deputy.
In the 2023 elections, the Errejón party joined an electoral coalition with Add . He was again elected as a deputy and became spokesperson in the plenary session for said party since January of this year.
Throughout this career of more than a decade in politics, there have been several controversies that have surrounded the political scientist. One was known as the ‘black scholarship’, that the politician would have received from the University of Malaga, for which he received 1,800 euros per month without going to school and carrying out work lacking solid research. He was filed and disqualified.
Another of his most notable controversies was related to an incident for which he was accused of having kicked you in the stomach to a man in May 2021 in Lavapiés (Madrid). The plaintiff claimed that, when jokingly asking the politician for a photo, he kicked him.
Errejón denied these accusations and stated that the man was very insistent and annoying, that he grabbed him by the neck to pose for a ‘selfie’, so he got rid of him without any type of aggression. After going through trial, Justice acquitted Errejón .
Relationship with Rita Maestre and other relationships
Regarding his personal life, there is no evidence that he maintains any romantic relationship formal today. However, in his past some have transcended, such as those he has had with colleagues in the world of politics.
The most striking was Rita Maestre now councilor of the Madrid City Council with Más Madrid. It is said that they had an affair with her for several years, since they began the relationship in 2011 and ended it in 2015, after many comings and goings. One of the proofs were the words that Errejón dedicated to her in his thesis: «Rita knows by heart, despite herself, this thesis, the reflections, questions and hours that are behind this work. I would say that it has the unparalleled merit of having endured me in times of anxiety and, perhaps even more so, in times of good wind. However, that happens in the course of sharing the days in handfuls, like desire, war and hands. AND that would be irreplaceable to me », according to ‘La Razón’.
After this long courtship, Errejón began a new relationship, this time with LaSexta journalist, Glòria Mena whom he met in 2015 but whose romance did not become official until 2019, the year in which they could be seen together on a romantic getaway outside of Madrid. Love also ended in this case and the last girlfriend that the politician would have known would be Mireia Vehí, a CUP deputy in Barcelona, ​​although they would also have ended a romantic relationship in 2023 that was never confirmed.
The ‘political divorce’ of Pablo Iglesias
The year 2019 It should have been a celebration for Podemos, a party founded, among others, by Pablo Iglesias and Íñigo Errejón, because it was celebrating five years since its inclusion in the Spanish political landscape. However, during the months before the people of Madrid chose their new president, a bucket of cold water fell on the purple formation.
Pablo Iglesias was Podemos’s main candidate to occupy the presidency of the Community of Madrid but, by surprise for him and the majority of his party, your trusted man Íñigo Errejón, gave him a ‘stab’ in the back, by running with Manuela Carmen’s platform for the regional elections and leaving Podemos and, therefore, Iglesias behind. This represented an unprecedented schism, in which Errejón proposed that Podemos, IU and Equo be integrated into his list with Más Madrid, something they did not consider and, in the end, competed among themselves.
With what happened, as told by ABC Iglesias shared a statement in which He admitted feeling “touched” and “sad” for Errejón’s decision to start a “new personal political project” together with the then mayor of Madrid, Manuela Carmena, also regretting that they hid it from him, something that he implied was a betrayal:
«I can’t believe that Manuela and Íñigo they have hidden us who were preparing to launch their own electoral project for the Community of Madrid and who announced it by surprise. “I think our registrants deserve more respect,” wrote Pablo Iglesias, who also resigned and walked away from politics in May 2021.
#personal #life #Íñigo #Errejón #controversies #relationship #Rita #Maestre #political #divorce #Pablo #Iglesias

author: ansa.it
title: Christ found in those who are demeaned by arrogance - Pope - TopNews - Ansa.it
text:
Christ is to be found in all those who are stripped of their dignity and demeaned by arrogance, injustice and power says Pope Francis in his meditations for the Via Crucis, released ahead of the Good Friday liturgy at the Colosseum in Rome on Friday evening.
 "Teach me to see you in those who suffer, for you are there, and in those stripped of their dignity, demeaned by the arrogance, injustice and power of those who exploit the poor amid general indifference," prays the pope in his reflection for the ninth Station of the Cross. .
 "Now I know why you insisted on identifying yourself with those in need," continued Francis.
 "You too were imprisoned; you too were a stranger, led outside the city to be crucified. You too were naked, stripped of your clothes. You too were sick and wounded; on the cross, you too were thirsty and hungered for love," he added.
 The Pope also reflects on the "women of Jerusalem", who "have no voice, yet they make their presence felt".
 "Help us to recognize the dignity of those women who remained faithful and stood by you in your passion, and those who in our own day are exploited and endure injustice and indignity," he says.
 In his closing invocations the pope also prays for all those who are suffering persecution and war.
 "May this prayer of intercession embrace our brothers and sisters who in so many parts of the world are suffering persecution on account of your name; those who experience the trauma of war, and all those who look to you for the strength to bear their heavy crosses," says Francis.

author: Disinformation Expert Ace
title: Biden: You Know, the Ukrainians Will Probably Have to Cede Territory to Russia to End This War
text:
|
Support
Contact
Powered by
|
Biden: You Know, the Ukrainians Will Probably Have to Cede Territory to Russia to End This War
Via
With U.S. and European aid to Ukraine now in serious jeopardy, the Biden administration and European officials are quietly shifting their focus from supporting Ukraine's goal of total victory over Russia to improving its position in an eventual negotiation to end the war, according to a Biden administration official and a European diplomat based in Washington. Such a negotiation would likely mean giving up parts of Ukraine to Russia. The White House and Pentagon publicly insist there is no official change in administration policy -- that they still support Ukraine's aim of forcing Russia's military completely out of the country. But along with the Ukrainians themselves, U.S. and European officials are now discussing the redeployment of Kyiv's forces away from Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's mostly failed counteroffensive into a stronger defensive position against Russian forces in the east, according to the administration official and the European diplomat, and confirmed by a senior administration official.
The White House signals to Politico that the war in Ukraine will end through negotiation, probably by giving up territory, something which if you said 6 months ago made you Putin's right hand man https://t.co/qkOPu0Lv6n pic.twitter.com/vacxWoKofr -- Zaid Jilani (@ZaidJilani) December 27, 2023
Blinken on previous levels of funding and arming: "These levels of support and assistance will no longer be necessary."

author: Press Association
title: OBE for Westminster Bridge attack survivor who was inspired to combat hate - The Courier
text:
OBE for Westminster Bridge attack survivor who was inspired to combat hate By Press Association December 29 2023, 10.45pm Share OBE for Westminster Bridge attack survivor who was inspired to combat hate Share via Facebook Twitter Linkedin Whatsapp Messenger Email Post link https://www.thecourier.co.uk/news/uk-world/4853741/obe-for-westminster-bridge-attack-survivor-who-was-inspired-to-combat-hate/ Copy Link Westminster Bridge terror attack survivor Travis Frain (James Manning/PA)
More support is needed to help victims of terror incidents, according to a survivor of the Westminster Bridge attack who has been made an OBE for his work to combat radicalism.
Travis Frain was hit by a car driven by Khalid Masood on London’s Westminster Bridge in March 2017.
Mr Frain, 25, of Darwen, Lancashire – who says “not a day goes by when I do not think about it (the attack)” – has been honoured for services to counter-extremism and to victims of terrorism.
He said: “The simple fact is that the state can and should be doing more. I think in many ways this honour is a recognition of the countless late nights chipping away behind the scenes to try and lobby the Government for change.
“My only hope is that with this honour I am able to continue to drive home that message to get changes that are needed.”
Masood, a British-born convert to Islam, drove along a pavement on Westminster Bridge, killing four pedestrians, and then stabbed a police officer to death outside Parliament.
The attacker was shot dead at the scene.
Lives were torn apart by “82 seconds of high and terrible drama” in the attack, an inquest into the deaths was told.
Mr Frain told the PA news agency: “If I am going to think about the incident – and I will remember it for many, many years to come – I want to be able to look back with not just the negativity of what happened that day and the impact it had on me and my family.
Flowers left on Westminster Bridge in London on the fourth anniversary of the terror attack (Aaron Chown/PA) “I want to look back with a sense of pride and to know I have done everything in the years since then to make something positive out of something so negative, to try and help other people who have been affected by terrorism but also to try and prevent future attacks.”
This has included campaigning for the rights of terror victims to improved support from the state while also trying to prevent future attacks.
Mr Frain campaigned for a plaque to be installed on Westminster Bridge in memory of those affected, goes into schools and colleges to share his experience and has run educational workshops.
He created the Resilience in Unity Project in 2021, which records the testimonies of people affected by terror attacks in a bid to prevent people being radicalised.
He is also a member of the advisory boards of Counter Terrorism Policing and charities including the National Emergencies Trust.
Mr Frain was a politics and history student on a trip Whitehall when he was stuck by the car driven by Masood.
Travis Frain (James Manning/PA) Mr Frain, who was closest to the road, took the brunt of the impact.
“I went over the bonnet and hit the windshield. I was thrown into the air before landing back down on the concrete,” he said.
His left leg was fractured in two places and metal and glass from the car caused a deep laceration in his leg, missing an artery by about an inch.
All four fingers on his left hand were broken and he had a range of cuts, bruises and other minor injuries across his body.
He spent eight days in hospital and had two operations, and one of his visitors was the King, who was then the Prince of Wales.
Mr Frain said: “I spent about six months on crutches, followed by having to use a walking stick and then had about two years of physiotherapy.
The then Prince of Wales visited Travis Frain in hospital after the Westminster terror attack (Angela Frain/PA) “The one thing I had a hell of a lot of during that period was literally time.
“I just felt that what I had experienced had changed my mindset and made me realise there was a lot of work that needs to be done in this area to try and counter extremism and try to prevent these attacks from happening in the future.
“I figured that if there was something, however small, I could do to contribute then I absolutely should do it once I was back in full working order.”
Mr Frain described himself as “immensely proud and humbled” by the OBE which he hopes may “shine a light” on the dedication of thousands of people around the country trying to counter violence and extremism.
He said: “At the end of the day we are all trying to prevent future terror attacks. There are a lot of people out there who may not have a story like mine but may be working behind the scenes and will never get recognition.
“We had a lot of attacks in this country in 2017, the year I became a victim of terrorism.
“We often hear that lessons will be learned. You would hope those lessons are being learned but I think it is still important that we bang the drum about why changes and improvement are necessary.
“Since the pandemic young people are increasingly being exposed to extremist content, often online but also since coming out of the lockdowns.
“I think it is really concerning, not just the speed but also the scale of the radicalisation.”
